title: Former World Boxing Champion Ricky Hatton Dies at 46
snippets: Ricky Hatton, known as 'The Hitman', was found dead at home in Manchester earlier. The former world champion was set to return to the ring in December.
British boxing icon Ricky Hatton has died at 46, sparking tributes from across sport.
Former world champion Ricky Hatton, nicknamed "The Hitman," has been found dead at his Manchester home, just weeks after revealing plans to return to the ring in December.

Hatton, known throughout his career as the Hitman, was one of the best-known British fighters of his generation

  • Obituary: Ricky Hatton (1978-2025)

Tributes have been paid to the British
Ricky Hatton has died aged 46.
Ricky Hatton, the former world boxing champion who rose to become one of the most popular fighters in the sport, has died. He was 46.
titles: Beckham and Fury lead tributes to champion boxer Ricky Hatton after his death aged 46
Former boxing world champion Ricky Hatton dies aged 46
UK boxer Ricky Hatton dies at 46 after comeback announcement
Ricky Hatton, former boxing world champion, dies aged 46
Ricky Hatton dies aged 46
Ricky Hatton, former world boxing champion, dies at 46
summary: Former world boxing champion Ricky Hatton has passed away at the age of 46. Known for his all-action style and success in the light welterweight and welterweight divisions, Hatton was a celebrated figure in British boxing. He was found unresponsive at a residence in Greater Manchester. Hatton, nicknamed the Hitman, retired in 2012 and leaves behind a legacy as one of the most beloved British fighters of his generation. Tributes from the boxing community and fans are pouring in to honor his memory.

title: Utah Man Arrested in Shooting Death of Activist Charlie Kirk
snippets: He adds that "much more evidence and information" will become available once charges are filed in the case.
Gov. Spencer Cox, R-Utah, said Sunday that the suspect in the shooting that killed conservative activist Charlie Kirk is not cooperating with authorities.

Spencer Cox says suspect, who isn’t cooperating with officials, had been ‘radicalized’ and was in relationship with person transitioning from male to female

The Utah governor, Spencer Cox, on Sunday told national talkshows that the man
Officials arrested 22-year-old Tyler Robinson on Friday in connection with Charlie Kirk's death. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox said he has not confessed.
titles: Kirk suspect 'not co-operating' with authorities, governor says
Utah governor says alleged Kirk shooter not cooperating with authorities
Kirk shooting suspect had ‘very different ideology’ than conservative family, Utah governor says
Utah Gov. Spencer Cox says suspect in Charlie Kirk's death 'is not cooperating'
summary: Utah Governor Spencer Cox announced that 22-year-old Tyler Robinson was arrested for the shooting death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Cox stated that Robinson is not cooperating with authorities and emphasized that more information will be available after charges are filed. He also mentioned that Robinson had been "radicalized" and was in a relationship with an individual transitioning from male to female. Robinson has yet to confess to the crime.

Romania condemns Russian drone violation of its airspace
Romania Says Russian Drone Entered Its Airspace
summary: Ukraine's President Zelensky described a recent Russian drone incursion as an expansion of the war. This incident marks the second time in less than a week that Russian drones have entered NATO airspace, with NATO jets previously intercepting drones in Polish airspace.

summary: Joe Burrow, the Bengals quarterback, injured his big toe and was seen leaving the locker room on crutches with a boot on his left foot after the incident in the second quarter. Despite this, Cincinnati secured a 31-27 win against the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sunday.

title: Eagles Triumph Over Chiefs 20-17 in Super Bowl LIX Rematch
snippets: The Philadelphia Eagles defeated the Kansas City Chiefs 20-17 in Week 2 Super Bowl LIX rematch.

Jalen Hurts and Saquon Barkley had touchdown runs, and Andrew Mukuba came up with a big fourth-quarter interception of Patrick Mahomes, helping the Eagles to a 20-17 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday in a rematch of a Super Bowl that Philadelphia won in a rout.
titles: Final score: Eagles defeat Chiefs 20-17 in Week 2 Super Bowl LIX rematch
Rookies Are Up: Chiefs, Eagles Announce Inactives for Super Bowl Rematch - Sports Illustrated
Eagles beat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch
summary: The Philadelphia Eagles won against the Kansas City Chiefs with a score of 20-17 in a Week 2 Super Bowl LIX rematch. Key players included Jalen Hurts and Saquon Barkley, who scored touchdown runs, and Andrew Mukuba, who secured a crucial fourth-quarter interception of Patrick Mahomes.

title: Vuelta a España Final Stage Canceled Due to Protests in Madrid
snippets: The final stage of the Vuelta a Espana is abandoned after pro-Palestinian protesters enter the course in the centre of Madrid.
The final stage of the Vuelta a Espana is abandoned after pro-Palestinian protesters enter the course in the centre of Madrid.
Pro-Palestine demonstrators have repeatedly targeted the Israel-Premier Tech cycling team during the race in Spain.

• Organisers cancel stage and declare Vingegaard winner

  • Protesters threw barricades into the street on Gran Vía

The final stage of the Vuelta a España was abandoned in chaotic and violent scenes, after groups of pro-Palestine protesters swamped the finish line
titles: Final stage of Spanish cycling race abandoned after pro-Palestine protests
Final stage of Vuelta abandoned because of protests
Spain’s Vuelta cycling finale abandoned after massive pro-Palestine protest
Vingegaard wins Vuelta after final stage cancelled amid pro-Palestinian protests in Madrid
summary: The final stage of the Vuelta a España was abandoned after pro-Palestinian protesters disrupted the course in Madrid, targeting the Israel-Premier Tech team. Protesters threw barricades onto Gran Vía, leading to chaotic scenes. Organizers canceled the stage and declared Vingegaard the winner.

title: Ontario Liberal Leader Crombie Stays After 57% Vote Against Leadership Race
snippets: Crombie initially said she planned to stay on as leader, adding that a leadership race right now would do more harm than good for the party.

Ontario Liberal Leader Bonnie Crombie is indicating she will stay on as leader, after party delegates voted against having a new leadership race — though only narrowly. Voting was taking place through the weekend at the party’s annual general meeting in Toronto and 57 per cent of delegates sai
titles: Bonnie Crombie to resign as Ontario Liberal leader after weak show of support
Bonnie Crombie vows to stay on as Ontario Liberal leader despite weak vote of support
summary: Ontario Liberal Leader Bonnie Crombie will remain in her position after 57% of party delegates voted against initiating a new leadership race during the party's annual general meeting in Toronto. Crombie had previously stated that a leadership race at this time would be detrimental to the party.

title: Fox Host Kilmeade Apologizes for Lethal Injection Comment on Homeless
snippets: Brian Kilmeade, co-host of 'Fox & Friends,' suggested 'involuntary lethal injection' for people who refuse mental health care.
Brian Kilmeade was discussing the aftermath of the murder of Ukrainian refugee Iryna Zarutska in North Carolina.

Fox News Channel host Brian Kilmeade apologized on Sunday for advocating for the execution of mentally ill homeless people in a discussion on the network last week, saying his remark was “extremely callous.” Kilmeade’s initial comment came on a “Fox & Friends” episode Wednesday and began g
titles: Fox News host apologizes for remarks about killing mentally ill homeless people
Fox News Host Apologizes For Suggesting ‘Involuntary Lethal Injection’ For Mentally Ill Homeless Refusing Help
Fox News’ Brian Kilmeade apologizes for saying mentally ill homeless people should be executed
summary: Fox News host Brian Kilmeade apologized for his comment suggesting 'involuntary lethal injection' for mentally ill homeless people who refuse care, made during a discussion on "Fox & Friends." His remark, described as "extremely callous," followed the murder of Ukrainian refugee Iryna Zarutska in North Carolina.

title: PM Denounces Flag Misuse at Far-Right Rally Urged by Musk
snippets: The prime minister said the flag represents "our diverse country" and he will not allow people to feel intimidated.
Antifascist campaign group Hope Not Hate condemns speeches at Saturday's rally in London as 'extremely disturbing'.

Exclusive: PM condemns attacks against police, racist intimidation of minorities and use of flag to instil fear

  • What England’s flag-hoiste
titles: We will never surrender our flag, Sir Keir Starmer says
Starmer says UK will ‘never surrender’ flag to far-right protesters
Britain will ‘never surrender flag’ to far-right protesters, Starmer says
summary: The Prime Minister condemned the use of the national flag to instill fear and racist intimidation at a rally organized by a far-right activist, which Elon Musk urged Brits to 'fight back or die' at. The PM emphasized the flag's representation of the country's diversity and denounced attacks against police and minorities. The antifascist group Hope Not Hate labeled speeches at the London event as 'extremely disturbing.'

title: Ohtani Seeks to Dismiss Lawsuit Over Hawaii Real Estate Job Loss
snippets: Shohei Ohtani and agent Nez Balelo moved to dismiss a lawsuit filed last month accusing them of being the reason a Hawaii real estate investor and broker got fired.

Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani and his agent, Nez Balelo, moved to dismiss a lawsuit filed last month accusing them of causing a Hawaii real estate investor and broker to be fired from a $240 million luxury housing development on the Big Island’s Hapuna Coast.  Ohtani and Balelo were sued Au
titles: Ohtani's lawyers move to dismiss real estate suit
Ohtani's lawyers claim he was victim of likeness misuse in real estate deal, move to dismiss lawsuit
summary: Los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani and his agent, Nez Balelo, have filed a motion to dismiss a lawsuit that accused them of causing a Hawaii real estate investor and broker to lose their job on a $240 million luxury housing project on the Big Island’s Hapuna Coast. The lawsuit was filed last month.

title: Blue Jays Sweep Orioles 11-2, Bieber Dominates on Mound
snippets: Shane Bieber surrendered one run in six innings, and Ernie Clement and George Springer knocked in two runs apiece to help the Toronto Blue Jays to an 11-2 win to sweep the Baltimore Orioles on Sunday.

Sunday afternoon at Rogers Centre, there was a distinct feeling of possibility around the Blue Jays.

After a sweep of the Orioles, there is real a sense of momentum around this team.

George Springer’s phenomenal season continued for the Toronto Blue Jays, going three-for-five from the plate with a home run and two RBIs as the Blue Jays completed the sweep of the Baltimore Orioles with an 11-2 win.
titles: Blue Jays beat Orioles 11-2 to complete sweep
Blue Jays tighten grasp on first place in AL East with sweep of Orioles
MLB Highlights: Blue Jays 11, Orioles 2
summary: Shane Bieber pitched six innings, allowing only one run, while Ernie Clement and George Springer each contributed two RBIs in the Toronto Blue Jays' 11-2 victory over the Baltimore Orioles. This win completed a series sweep on Sunday. George Springer notably went three-for-five, hitting a home run. The win at Rogers Centre has bolstered the Blue Jays' momentum.

title: Top Prospect Yesavage to Debut for Blue Jays in Pennant Race
snippets: Highly touted pitching prospect Trey Yesavage is slated to make his major league debut with the Toronto Blue Jays on Monday against the Tampa Bay Rays.
Trey Yesavage will be diving in the deep end. The Toronto Blue Jays called the top pitching prospect up to the big leagues on Sunday, where he’ll join a team in the thick of a pennant race.
titles: Trey Yesavage to make Blue Jays debut Monday
Blue Jays call up top pitching prospect Trey Yesavage to start Monday vs. Rays
summary: Trey Yesavage, a top pitching prospect, is set to make his major league debut for the Toronto Blue Jays against the Tampa Bay Rays on Monday. His call-up comes as the Blue Jays are in the midst of a pennant race.

title: "Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle" Becomes Japan's Third-Highest Grossing Film
snippets: The anime has already become Japan’s third-highest grossing film of all time.

LOS ANGELES (AP) — “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba _ Infinity Castle” carved out a place in box-office history this weekend as the Japanese anime film sliced straight to No. 1 _ outpacing the horror sequel “The Conjuring: Last Rites.” The Sony-owned Crunchyroll release
titles: ‘Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle’ Breaks Anime Record With $70 Million Opening Weekend At Domestic Box Office
‘Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle’ opens to $70M, biggest anime debut to claim top box-office spot
summary: "Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - Infinity Castle" became Japan's third-highest grossing film ever and topped the box office in its opening weekend, surpassing "The Conjuring: Last Rites." The anime, released by Sony-owned Crunchyroll, achieved significant commercial success.

title: Penske Media Sues Google Over Forced AI Summaries Use
snippets: Disclosure: Penske Media Corporation is an investor in Vox Media, The Verge’s parent company. Penske Media Corporation, the publisher of Rolling Stone and The Hollywood Reporter, has become the first major American media company to sue Google over its AI summaries. The company claims that the AI Ove
Penske's lawsuit accuses Google of abusing its monopoly power in search to force publishers to support AI summaries.
titles: Rolling Stone’s parent company sues Google over AI Overviews
Rolling Stone owner Penske Media sues Google over AI summaries
summary: Penske Media Corporation, owner of Rolling Stone and The Hollywood Reporter, has filed a lawsuit against Google, accusing it of abusing its monopoly power by forcing publishers to adopt AI summaries. This marks the first major legal action by an American media company against Google over AI summaries.

title: Lough Neagh Faces Third Year of Toxic Algae Due to Farm Pollution
snippets:
Signs tout a natural paradise, but pollution from over-farming has left Northern Ireland’s Lough Neagh choked by toxic algae

The bright, cheery signs dot the shoreline like epistles from another era, a time before the calamity.

“Ballyronan marina is a picturesque boating and tourist f
For the third year running toxic blue-green algae blooms that look like pea soup and smell like rotten eggs have covered much of Lough Neagh, the largest lake in the UK and Ireland.
titles: ‘It’s dying in front of our eyes’: how the UK’s largest lake became an ecological disaster
UK's largest lake 'dying' as algae blooms worsen
summary: Lough Neagh, the UK and Ireland's largest lake, is experiencing its third consecutive year of toxic blue-green algae blooms, caused by pollution from over-farming. Despite signs promoting it as a natural paradise, the lake is now choked with algae that resembles pea soup and emits a rotten egg smell, impacting its status as a picturesque boating and tourist destination.

title: Trump's Second UK Visit Sees US-UK Nuclear Deal
snippets: With state banquets and country-house visits, U.S. President Donald Trump has a busy few days planned as he embarks on his second state visit to the U.K.

The US and Britain will sign an agreement to make it quicker for companies in both countries to build nuclear power stations when President Donald Trump visits this week, according to the UK government.
titles: Global week ahead: From royal pomp to tech deals as Trump visits the U.K.
US-UK Nuclear Pact to Precede Tech, Whisky Deals on Trump Visit
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump is on his second state visit to the U.K., featuring state banquets and country-house visits. During this visit, the U.S. and Britain will sign an agreement aimed at accelerating the process for companies in both countries to construct nuclear power stations, as announced by the UK government.
